comments.title: This product contains Dextrose a form of sugar
comments.description: Dextrose is first ingredient. This is just like sugar. Please check this out before buying. If you are purchasing this because you want a sugar substitute or are diabetic or pre-diabetic or glucose intolerant then this product doesn't seem to be what you want.

comments.title: False label
comments.description: It's dextrose more than Stevia. It's not at all sugar free. Dextrose is a sugar. It may be sucrose free, but it's not sugar free. Calling it sugar free when the main ingredient is dextrose is just lying. I didn't read the label properly. I regret the purchase.

comments.title: Even unhealhty then sugar
comments.description: This product has dextrose and maltdexitrin. maltdexitrin is even cheaper & unhealthier alternative to sugar. Its best to avoid. Better to find something 100% stevia made with no fillers or hidden ingredients....

comments.title: Stevia
comments.description: This is a big packet. Please do not buy this if you haven't tasted stevia before. I went and bought the biggest packet and I did not feel like drinking stevia sweetened coffee after the first cup so now it is still sitting there on my kitchen cupboard.

comments.title: An evil advertisement scheme
comments.description: Please don't buy this. It is really bad for health, because it includes dextrose and maltodextrose which will spike your insulin levels. Keep away from this brand and buy from other legitimate brands which don't include those ingredients.

comments.title: Its a Joke...if u see ingredients
comments.description: Maltodextrin and  Dextrose as ingredients...defeat he purpose of using stevia..

comments.title: Contains sugar
comments.description: Check the nutrition label it has sugar in it and secondly check the ingredients it has bulking agents like dextrose. Dextrose means you are getting sugar .

comments.title: Dangerous Maltodextrin. Do not buy.
comments.description: I wasn't aware that it contains a dangerous thickener called maltodextrin, but I realized it has GI index of 110 , while regular sugar is only 65, which means the purpose of this stevia is nullified and defeated. What's the point of eating double dosage sugar cunningly entitled as sugar free? Government should ban the use of maltodextrin. It raised the blood sugar like never before, and I found the culprit. Now regular sugar seems like a Savior.

comments.title: Perfect substitute for sugar

comments.title: A tasteless, bland product.
